data.title: MTAM mHealth Symposium for Mobile/Wireless Tech Professionals
data.text:
Linda Daichendt

Executive Director, Mobile Technology Association of Michigan and Michigan's leading proponent for the use of mobile/wireless technologies in every industry

Mobile Technology Association of Michigan

twitter

linkedin

Linda Daichendt is the Executive Director of the Mobile Technology Association of Michigan, a Co-founder of Mobile Monday Michigan, a Co-host/Co-producer of the international mobile marketing podcast series, ‘The Mobile Marketing Review’, a Co-host of the ‘This Week in Small Business Technology’ podcast series on the Michigan Business Network, and Executive Producer for the podcast series, ‘Michigan Mobile Musings’. She is also a Board Member for the Michigan STEM Partnership.

Linda is an accomplished marketer and award-winning blogger, and one of Michigan’s leading proponents of the use of mobile/wireless technologies for businesses of all sizes – and in all industries. She is a recognized business expert with 20+ years of corporate, small business and franchising experience.

A 15-year resident of her adopted home state of Michigan, Linda’s daily focus is on educating Michigan business, government and education stakeholders about the opportunities that mobile/wireless technologies provide to substantially grow Michigan’s economy, as well as insuring the ability for all Michigan residents to benefit from the jobs and businesses created by those technologies.

Welcome / Opening Remarks / Moderator Introduction

Close

Steve Grant

Medical Director

HAP Midwest Health Plan

Steven Grant, M.D., F.A.C.P., is the current Medical Director of HAP Midwest Health Plan. He has over two decades of experience in leading physician organizations, both as independent organizations and in partnership with hospitals." Dr.

Grant served as Executive Vice President of Physician Partnerships for the Detroit

Medical Center (DMC) from April 2010 through April 2013. During this period, Dr. Grant

cultivated relationships between private practice physicians and the hospital system. He

spearheaded the DMC’s effort to transform physician care across its hospitals and how

coordinated care would play into the national health care reform effort. He led the effort

to create the DMC Physician Hospital Organization, a multispeciality PHO, and was its

first, and only, Executive Director. He was a member of the team which created and

managed one of the Pioneer ACO’s.

Dr. Grant was the co-founder and, from 2000 until 2010, served as President and CEO

of United Physicians. With more than 2,000 physicians and 100,000 covered HMO lives,

United Physicians was one of the largest physician organizations in Michigan.

Dr. Grant was the co-founder and former Chairman of my1HIE (“my1 health information

exchange”) which focused on the physician-patient relationship and the role of physician

engagement in advancing health information technology.

Dr. Grant is a member of the Board of Directors and the Executive Committee of the

Great Detroit Area Health Council. Dr. Grant also serves as chairperson for GDAHC’s

Performance Measurement and Public Reporting Team. His leadership with GDAHC

has been instrumental in securing broad physician participation across GDAHC

initiatives, and in helping to launch the first in Michigan, and one of the first in the

country, online multi-payer provider performance report.

Since 1979, Dr. Grant has had a private practice in general internal medicine. He is a

Fellow of the American College of Physicians. He is an assistant clinical professor at

Wayne State University School of Medicine. He received his Bachelor of Arts and

Doctor of Medicine from the University of Michigan and completed his residency in

Internal Medicine at William Beaumont Hospital, Royal Oak.

Healthcare Industry Expert

Audience Q&A

Close

Rodger Prong

CEO of Oakland Physicians Network Services

Oakland Physicians Network Services

twitter

linkedin

Rodger Prong, the Executive Director of Oakland Physician Network Services Physician Corporation has expressed that his most important achievement has been establishing and maintaining a professional reputation for high integrity leadership and professional personal standards.

With over 30 years of leadership experience, Prong is recognized as a visionary with a talent for energizing and motivating others. His involvement in the healthcare industry in Southeast Michigan has included Clinic establishment and operations, Physician organization operations and Health Plan management. In this arena he was pivotal in the rapid growth and success of two of Southeast Michigan's most profitable Medicaid Managed Care health insurance companies.

A Business and Healthcare Management graduate of the Concordia University in Ann Arbor, MI, and with an MBA from the University of Phoenix, Prong has a proven track record for delivering innovative, comprehensive solutions that address the needs of patients, plans, employers and physicians.

As CEO of Oakland Physician Network and Physician Direct Connection, Rodger Prong has combined vision and science to develop a cutting-edge approach to health care. His vision is for an uninhibited, unhindered network where patients can receive the best healthcare benefits, employers and plans can manage costs and where physicians have the independence and control they need to provide the highest quality healthcare to patients. In this role at OPNS, Prong is focused on positioning the network into an evidence-based population management methodology of healthcare as the best model for both controlling cost while at the same time providing high-quality care.

Prong also serves as the Vice-Chair of the Michigan Primary Care Consortium, a collaborative non-profit partnership created to transform Michigan's primary healthcare system to improve the health of Michigan residents by advancing the delivery of preventative and chronic disease healthcare, and as the VP of Business for Development Centers, a non-profit organization committed to improving the lives of individuals, families and the community by meeting behavioral health, social and vocational needs through a continuum of prevention, treatment and training services. He also serves as the VP of the Board of Directors for the non-profit Z.I.A.D. Healthcare for the Underserved, and also fills a role as one of two Physician Provider/Ambulatory Care members of the Race Ethnicity and Language Committee to the Greater Detroit Area Health Council.

Oakland Physician Network Services is a multi-specialty independent physician organization of 450 physicians that is located in Southeast Michigan at 2360 Orchard Lake Road in Sylvan Lake, MI. The physicians deliver value-based care to 100,000 attributed members in 15 health plans including the Physician Direct Accountable Care Organization, the Physician Direct Organized System of Care and the Physician Direct Multi-employer Welfare Association, as well as the common public health insurance plans common to Southeastern Michigan. Clinical integration is being achieved through the Health Focus Data warehouse and registry that is accessible to all members of OPNS and with the increasing addition of the Great Lakes Health Connect Health Information Exchange and a cloud-based interoperable EMR. Lightbeam Analytics software is employed in the stratification of risk among ACO membership.

Healthcare Industry Expert

Audience Q&A

Close

Andrew Haig

Medical Director, Telemedicine and e-medicine

The University of Michigan

linkedin

Andrew Haig is director of the University of Michigan Health System e-Health Center, Tenured Professor of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation at The University of Michigan and president of Haig et al., Consulting. He has been recognized globally as an expert in clinical care, research, education, and program development.

As the first physician leader of telemedicine at Michigan Haig has focused on pragmatic sustainable business models of distant care. He established clinical pathways that allow practitioners to navigate through the legal, regulatory, institutional, record-keeping, billing, marketing and financial processes required for successful implementation of clinical telemedicine. He developed the models by which Michigan will use telemedicine for internal consultation, liaison with home health agencies and patients at home, partnership with other health systems and remote second opinions by select Michigan faculty.

Haig has received the top American awards for research, patient care, and teaching in his medical specialty of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. His pioneering research in diagnosing spinal disorders and in team rehabilitation have resulted in over 150 peer-reviewed scientific publications. He founded the U of M Spine program and its fellowship which, under his direction, was considered one of the best in the country. He has designed or consulted on numerous rehabilitation programs around the world under the auspices of the University of Michigan, the International Rehabilitation Forum (www.rehabforum.org) a non-governmental organization Haig founded, and his Haig et al., Consulting, LLC (www.haigetal.com).

A graduate of the University of Wisconsin—Milwaukee and the Medical College of Wisconsin where he continues as volunteer faculty, Dr. Haig completed his specialty training at the United States’ top-ranked Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago. He is certified by the American Board of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, with sub-specialization from the American Board of Electrodiagnostic Medicine and the American Board of Pain Medicine. He was formerly on the faculty of the University of Vermont and has been visiting professor at Vienna Medical University in Austria.

Outside of medicine Dr. Haig is an award winning creative writer, father, and master swimmer.

Healthcare Industry Expert

Audience Q&A

Close

Chuck Marlin

Event Moderator, MTAM mHealth Advisory Council Chairperson; President, Advanced Physicians Insurance; Managing Partner, Healthcare Technology Solutions

Healthcare Technology Solutions, LLC

twitter

linkedin

Chuck Marlin, MTAM’s mHealth Advisory Council Chairperson, is a healthcare technology advocate with a background that encompasses a diverse representation of specialty areas within the healthcare sector.

With Healthcare Technology Solutions, he acts as a consultant and a reseller/channel partner involved in selectively representing companies that have developed unique software solutions or technology/devices that relate to healthcare delivery or treatment. With Advanced Physicians Insurance Company, he handles day-to-day management of the financial, underwriting, claims and marketing of the organization. For Interstate Healthcare, Chuck manages an agency that is solely dedicated to insuring healthcare risks across the U.S. with a focus on providing professional liability coverage for physicians, physician groups, PO’s, PHO’s, ACO’s and other hybrid models.

With over 30 years focused on the healthcare industry, and a strong awareness of, and interest in, the impact of technology on the healthcare industry, Chuck is in a unique position of having access to diverse sectors within the industry, and is able to capitalize on that experience and network to benefit MTAM and the work of the mHealth Advisory Council.

Eric Stief

Director of Commercialization at the Beaumont Research Institute of the Beaumont Health System

Beaumont Research Institute / Beaumont Health System

linkedin

As the Director of Commercialization at Beaumont Health System Eric relies on a solid background of new technology commercialization. His experiences range from university technology transfer, to new startup venture creation, mergers and acquisitions work and research and development. He is actively involved with the local entrepreneurial and economic development communities and has broad industry experience ranging from a wide range of life sciences, automotive and consumer goods technologies.

Early in his career Eric worked at Kellogg Company where he prototyped and launched multiple new brands. After leaving Kellogg Eric switched his focus from scientific research and joined FMC Corporation to coordinate merger and acquisition activities and develop business plans for new business ventures. After FMC, Eric returned to Michigan to work with Wayne State University and Delphi Corporation, where he focused on technology licensing and new startup venture creation. While at WSU Eric also created and ran a hands-on program helping WSU students to start their own ventures during their summer break. After working with Delphi and WSU, Eric concurrently helped launch two startup ventures. Battle Creek Ingredients has helped major food companies to launch innovative new food products and AutoHarvest Foundation enables automotive industry innovators to collaborate using social media tools.

Eric has served on the Board of MichBio and reviews grants and business plans for the Michigan Initiative for Innovation and Entrepreneurship and the Great Lakes Entrepreneurs Quest. He has an M.B.A. from the University of Michigan and B.S. in Engineering from Michigan State University.

Audience Q&A

Healthcare Industry Expert

Close

Irene Spanos

Director, Economic Development & Community Affairs

Oakland County / Medical Main Street

linkedin

Irene Spanos was appointed director of the Department of Economic Development & Community Affairs by Oakland County Executive L. Brooks Patterson in 2011. As director, she oversees the operation of the department and its six divisions: Business Development (attraction/retention), Planning, Finance, Workforce Development, Marketing & Communication and Community & Home Improvement. Before her appointment, she spent seven years with the county as a senior business development representative, specializing in the bio-technology and medical devices sectors and was involved in the launch of Medical Main Street, the county’s initiative to grow the life sciences and health care industries in Southeast Michigan. She also worked with companies headquartered in Europe on growing their presence Oakland County.

She is a member of the Swedish, German & French American Chamber of Commerce, and Southfield's Healthcare Corridor board. Spanos sits on the Mechatronics Certificate advisory board for Oakland Community College, on the advisory board of Oakland University’s Incubator: OU INC and is a member of the Michigan Economic Developers Association and the International Economic Development Council (IEDC) Research Group. She recently was asked to sit on a National Economic Development board focused on Foreign Direct Investment.

Medical Main Street Welcome
